description: JSON schema for CSL input data

language.description:
The language of the item;
Should be entered as an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code (e.g. “en”, “zh”), optionally with a two-letter locale code (e.g. “de-DE”, “de-AT”

accessed.title: Date the item has been accessed

available-date.title: Date the item was initially available
available-date.description: e.g. the online publication date of a journal article before its formal publication date; the date a treaty was made available for signing

event-date.title: Date the event related to an item took place

original-date.title: Issue date of the original version

submitted.title: Date the item (e.g. a manuscript) was submitted for publication

archive_collection.title: Collection the item is part of within an archive

archive_location.title: Storage location within an archive (e.g. a box and folder number)

authority.description: Issuing or judicial authority (e.g. “USPTO” for a patent, “Fairfax Circuit Court” for a legal case)

call-number.title: Call number (to locate the item in a library)

collection-title.description: Title of the collection holding the item (e.g. the series title for a book; the lecture series title for a presentation)

container-title.description: Title of the container holding the item (e.g. the book title for a book chapter, the journal title for a journal article; the album title for a recording; the session title for multi-part presentation at a conference)

container-title-short.description: Short/abbreviated form of container-title; Deprecated; use variable="container-title" form="short" instead

dimensions.description: Physical (e.g. size) or temporal (e.g. running time) dimensions of the item

division.title: Minor subdivision of a court with a `jurisdiction` for a legal item

event.description: [Deprecated - use 'event-title' instead. Will be removed in 1.1]

event-title.description: Name of the event related to the item (e.g. the conference name when citing a conference paper; the meeting where presentation was made)

event-place.description: Geographic location of the event related to the item (e.g. “Amsterdam, The Netherlands”)

genre.description:
Type, class, or subtype of the item (e.g. “Doctoral dissertation” for a PhD thesis; “NIH Publication” for an NIH technical report);
Do not use for topical descriptions or categories (e.g. “adventure” for an adventure movie)

issue.description: Issue number of the item or container holding the item (e.g. “5” when citing a journal article from journal volume 2, issue 5);

jurisdiction.description: Geographic scope of relevance (e.g. “US” for a US patent; the court hearing a legal case)

keyword.title: Keyword(s) or tag(s) attached to the item

medium.title: Description of the item's format or medium

note.title: Descriptive text or notes about an item

number.description: Number identifying the item (e.g. a report number)

page.description: Range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue)

page-first.description: First page of the range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue)

references.description:
Resources related to the procedural history of a legal case or legislation;
Can also be used to refer to the procedural history of other items (e.g. “Conference canceled” for a presentation accepted as a conference that was subsequently canceled; details of a retraction or correction notice)

reviewed-genre.title: Type of the item being reviewed by the current item

reviewed-title.title: Title of the item reviewed by the current item

scale.title: Scale of e.g. a map or model

section.title: Section of the item or container holding the item
section.description: e.g. “§2.0.1” for a law; “politics” for a newspaper article

source.title: Source from whence the item originates (e.g. a library catalog or database)

title-short.description:
Short/abbreviated form of title;
Deprecated; use variable="title" form="short" instead

volume.description:
Volume number of the item (e.g. “2” when citing volume 2 of a book) or the container holding the item (e.g. “2” when citing a chapter from volume 2 of a book);
Use volume-title for the title of the volume, if any

volume-title.title: Title of the volume of the item or container holding the item
volume-title.description: Also use for titles of periodical special issues, special sections, and the like

year-suffix.title: Disambiguating year suffix in author-date styles

custom.title: Custom key-value pairs.
custom.description: Used to store additional information that does not have a designated CSL JSON field. The custom field is preferred over the note field for storing custom data, particularly for storing key-value pairs, as the note field is used for user annotations in annotated bibliography styles.

date-variable.title: Date content model.
date-variable.description: The CSL input model supports two different date representations: an EDTF string (preferred), and a more structured alternative.

date-parts.description: Array of variable length: first element is year, second month, last is day
